summary.long: John is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text:
In the beginning the Word already existed.
    The Word was with God,
    and the Word was God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He existed in the beginning with God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God created everything through him,
    and nothing was created except through him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Word gave life to everything that was created,
    and his life brought light to everyone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The light shines in the darkness,
    and the darkness can never extinguish it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God sent a man, John the Baptist,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: to tell about the light so that everyone might believe because of his testimony.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John himself was not the light; he was simply a witness to tell about the light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The one who is the true light, who gives light to everyone, was coming into the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He came into the very world he created, but the world didn’t recognize him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He came to his own people, and even they rejected him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But to all who believed him and accepted him, he gave the right to become children of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They are reborn—not with a physical birth resulting from human passion or plan, but a birth that comes from God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Word became human and made his home among us. He was full of unfailing love and faithfulness. And we have seen his glory, the glory of the Father’s one and only Son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John testified about him when he shouted to the crowds, “This is the one I was talking about when I said, ‘Someone is coming after me who is far greater than I am, for he existed long before me.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: From his abundance we have all received one gracious blessing after another.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the law was given through Moses, but God’s unfailing love and faithfulness came through Jesus Christ.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one has ever seen God. But the unique One, who is himself God, is near to the Father’s heart. He has revealed God to us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was John’s testimony when the Jewish leaders sent priests and Temple assistants from Jerusalem to ask John, “Who are you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He came right out and said, “I am not the Messiah.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Well then, who are you?” they asked. “Are you Elijah?”
“No,” he replied.
“Are you the Prophet we are expecting?”
“No.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Then who are you? We need an answer for those who sent us. What do you have to say about yourself?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
John replied in the words of the prophet Isaiah: 
“I am a voice shouting in the wilderness,
    ‘Clear the way for the Lord’s coming!’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Pharisees who had been sent
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: asked him, “If you aren’t the Messiah or Elijah or the Prophet, what right do you have to baptize?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John told them, “I baptize with water, but right here in the crowd is someone you do not recognize.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Though his ministry follows mine, I’m not even worthy to be his slave and untie the straps of his sandal.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This encounter took place in Bethany, an area east of the Jordan River, where John was baptizing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day John saw Jesus coming toward him and said, “Look! The Lamb of God who takes away the sin of the world!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is the one I was talking about when I said, ‘A man is coming after me who is far greater than I am, for he existed long before me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I did not recognize him as the Messiah, but I have been baptizing with water so that he might be revealed to Israel.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then John testified, “I saw the Holy Spirit descending like a dove from heaven and resting upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I didn’t know he was the one, but when God sent me to baptize with water, he told me, ‘The one on whom you see the Spirit descend and rest is the one who will baptize with the Holy Spirit.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I saw this happen to Jesus, so I testify that he is the Chosen One of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The following day John was again standing with two of his disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Jesus walked by, John looked at him and declared, “Look! There is the Lamb of God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When John’s two disciples heard this, they followed Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus looked around and saw them following. “What do you want?” he asked them.
They replied, “Rabbi” (which means “Teacher”), “where are you staying?”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “Come and see,” he said. It was about four o’clock in the afternoon when they went with him to the place where he was staying, and they remained with him the rest of the day.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother, was one of these men who heard what John said and then followed Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Andrew went to find his brother, Simon, and told him, “We have found the Messiah” (which means “Christ”).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Andrew brought Simon to meet Jesus. Looking intently at Simon, Jesus said, “Your name is Simon, son of John—but you will be called Cephas” (which means “Peter”).
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The next day Jesus decided to go to Galilee. He found Philip and said to him, “Come, follow me.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Philip was from Bethsaida, Andrew and Peter’s hometown.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Philip went to look for Nathanael and told him, “We have found the very person Moses and the prophets wrote about! His name is Jesus, the son of Joseph from Nazareth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Nazareth!” exclaimed Nathanael. “Can anything good come from Nazareth?”
“Come and see for yourself,” Philip replied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As they approached, Jesus said, “Now here is a genuine son of Israel—a man of complete integrity.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text:
“How do you know about me?” Nathanael asked.
Jesus replied, “I could see you under the fig tree before Philip found you.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then Nathanael exclaimed, “Rabbi, you are the Son of God—the King of Israel!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus asked him, “Do you believe this just because I told you I had seen you under the fig tree? You will see greater things than this.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then he said, “I tell you the truth, you will all see heaven open and the angels of God going up and down on the Son of Man, the one who is the stairway between heaven and earth.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The next day there was a wedding celebration in the village of Cana in Galilee. Jesus’ mother was there,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jesus and his disciples were also invited to the celebration.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The wine supply ran out during the festivities, so Jesus’ mother told him, “They have no more wine.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Dear woman, that’s not our problem,” Jesus replied. “My time has not yet come.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But his mother told the servants, “Do whatever he tells you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Standing nearby were six stone water jars, used for Jewish ceremonial washing. Each could hold twenty to thirty gallons.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told the servants, “Fill the jars with water.” When the jars had been filled,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: he said, “Now dip some out, and take it to the master of ceremonies.” So the servants followed his instructions.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: When the master of ceremonies tasted the water that was now wine, not knowing where it had come from (though, of course, the servants knew), he called the bridegroom over.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “A host always serves the best wine first,” he said. “Then, when everyone has had a lot to drink, he brings out the less expensive wine. But you have kept the best until now!”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: This miraculous sign at Cana in Galilee was the first time Jesus revealed his glory. And his disciples believed in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After the wedding he went to Capernaum for a few days with his mother, his brothers, and his disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was nearly time for the Jewish Passover celebration, so Jesus went to Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In the Temple area he saw merchants selling cattle, sheep, and doves for sacrifices; he also saw dealers at tables exchanging foreign money.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus made a whip from some ropes and chased them all out of the Temple. He drove out the sheep and cattle, scattered the money changers’ coins over the floor, and turned over their tables.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then, going over to the people who sold doves, he told them, “Get these things out of here. Stop turning my Father’s house into a marketplace!”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then his disciples remembered this prophecy from the Scriptures: “Passion for God’s house will consume me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the Jewish leaders demanded, “What are you doing? If God gave you authority to do this, show us a miraculous sign to prove it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “All right,” Jesus replied. “Destroy this temple, and in three days I will raise it up.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “What!” they exclaimed. “It has taken forty-six years to build this Temple, and you can rebuild it in three days?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Jesus said “this temple,” he meant his own body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After he was raised from the dead, his disciples remembered he had said this, and they believed both the Scriptures and what Jesus had said.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Because of the miraculous signs Jesus did in Jerusalem at the Passover celebration, many began to trust in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus didn’t trust them, because he knew all about people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one needed to tell him about human nature, for he knew what was in each person’s heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was a man named Nicodemus, a Jewish religious leader who was a Pharisee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After dark one evening, he came to speak with Jesus. “Rabbi,” he said, “we all know that God has sent you to teach us. Your miraculous signs are evidence that God is with you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “I tell you the truth, unless you are born again, you cannot see the Kingdom of God.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “What do you mean?” exclaimed Nicodemus. “How can an old man go back into his mother’s womb and be born again?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “I assure you, no one can enter the Kingdom of God without being born of water and the Spirit.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Humans can reproduce only human life, but the Holy Spirit gives birth to spiritual life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So don’t be surprised when I say, ‘You must be born again.’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The wind blows wherever it wants. Just as you can hear the wind but can’t tell where it comes from or where it is going, so you can’t explain how people are born of the Spirit.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “How are these things possible?” Nicodemus asked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “You are a respected Jewish teacher, and yet you don’t understand these things?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: I assure you, we tell you what we know and have seen, and yet you won’t believe our testimony.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But if you don’t believe me when I tell you about earthly things, how can you possibly believe if I tell you about heavenly things?
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: No one has ever gone to heaven and returned. But the Son of Man has come down from heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And as Moses lifted up the bronze snake on a pole in the wilderness, so the Son of Man must be lifted up,
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: so that everyone who believes in him will have eternal life.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “For this is how God loved the world: He gave his one and only Son, so that everyone who believes in him will not perish but have eternal life.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: God sent his Son into the world not to judge the world, but to save the world through him.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “There is no judgment against anyone who believes in him. But anyone who does not believe in him has already been judged for not believing in God’s one and only Son.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And the judgment is based on this fact: God’s light came into the world, but people loved the darkness more than the light, for their actions were evil.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: All who do evil hate the light and refuse to go near it for fear their sins will be exposed.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: But those who do what is right come to the light so others can see that they are doing what God wants.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Then Jesus and his disciples left Jerusalem and went into the Judean countryside. Jesus spent some time with them there, baptizing people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At this time John the Baptist was baptizing at Aenon, near Salim, because there was plenty of water there; and people kept coming to him for baptism.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (This was before John was thrown into prison.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A debate broke out between John’s disciples and a certain Jew over ceremonial cleansing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So John’s disciples came to him and said, “Rabbi, the man you met on the other side of the Jordan River, the one you identified as the Messiah, is also baptizing people. And everybody is going to him instead of coming to us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John replied, “No one can receive anything unless God gives it from heaven.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: You yourselves know how plainly I told you, ‘I am not the Messiah. I am only here to prepare the way for him.’
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: It is the bridegroom who marries the bride, and the bridegroom’s friend is simply glad to stand with him and hear his vows. Therefore, I am filled with joy at his success.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He must become greater and greater, and I must become less and less.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: “He has come from above and is greater than anyone else. We are of the earth, and we speak of earthly things, but he has come from heaven and is greater than anyone else.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: He testifies about what he has seen and heard, but how few believe what he tells them!
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Anyone who accepts his testimony can affirm that God is true.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: For he is sent by God. He speaks God’s words, for God gives him the Spirit without limit.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: The Father loves his Son and has put everything into his hands.
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: And anyone who believes in God’s Son has eternal life. Anyone who doesn’t obey the Son will never experience eternal life but remains under God’s angry judgment.”
verses.speaker: Jesus

verses.text: Jesus knew the Pharisees had heard that he was baptizing and making more disciples than John
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (though Jesus himself didn’t baptize them—his disciples did).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he left Judea and returned to Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He had to go through Samaria on the way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eventually he came to the Samaritan village of Sychar, near the field that Jacob gave to his son Joseph.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jacob’s well was there; and Jesus, tired from the long walk, sat wearily beside the well about noontime.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Soon a Samaritan woman came to draw water, and Jesus said to her, “Please give me a drink.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was alone at the time because his disciples had gone into the village to buy some food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The woman was surprised, for Jews refuse to have anything to do with Samaritans. She said to Jesus, “You are a Jew, and I am a Samaritan woman. Why are you asking me for a drink?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “If you only knew the gift God has for you and who you are speaking to, you would ask me, and I would give you living water.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But sir, you don’t have a rope or a bucket,” she said, “and this well is very deep. Where would you get this living water?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And besides, do you think you’re greater than our ancestor Jacob, who gave us this well? How can you offer better water than he and his sons and his animals enjoyed?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “Anyone who drinks this water will soon become thirsty again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But those who drink the water I give will never be thirsty again. It becomes a fresh, bubbling spring within them, giving them eternal life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Please, sir,” the woman said, “give me this water! Then I’ll never be thirsty again, and I won’t have to come here to get water.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Go and get your husband,” Jesus told her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I don’t have a husband,” the woman replied.
Jesus said, “You’re right! You don’t have a husband—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for you have had five husbands, and you aren’t even married to the man you’re living with now. You certainly spoke the truth!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Sir,” the woman said, “you must be a prophet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So tell me, why is it that you Jews insist that Jerusalem is the only place of worship, while we Samaritans claim it is here at Mount Gerizim, where our ancestors worshiped?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “Believe me, dear woman, the time is coming when it will no longer matter whether you worship the Father on this mountain or in Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You Samaritans know very little about the one you worship, while we Jews know all about him, for salvation comes through the Jews.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the time is coming—indeed it’s here now—when true worshipers will worship the Father in spirit and in truth. The Father is looking for those who will worship him that way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For God is Spirit, so those who worship him must worship in spirit and in truth.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The woman said, “I know the Messiah is coming—the one who is called Christ. When he comes, he will explain everything to us.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus told her, “I am the Messiah!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just then his disciples came back. They were shocked to find him talking to a woman, but none of them had the nerve to ask, “What do you want with her?” or “Why are you talking to her?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The woman left her water jar beside the well and ran back to the village, telling everyone,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Come and see a man who told me everything I ever did! Could he possibly be the Messiah?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the people came streaming from the village to see him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meanwhile, the disciples were urging Jesus, “Rabbi, eat something.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus replied, “I have a kind of food you know nothing about.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Did someone bring him food while we were gone?” the disciples asked each other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus explained: “My nourishment comes from doing the will of God, who sent me, and from finishing his work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You know the saying, ‘Four months between planting and harvest.’ But I say, wake up and look around. The fields are already ripe for harvest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The harvesters are paid good wages, and the fruit they harvest is people brought to eternal life. What joy awaits both the planter and the harvester alike!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You know the saying, ‘One plants and another harvests.’ And it’s true.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I sent you to harvest where you didn’t plant; others had already done the work, and now you will get to gather the harvest.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many Samaritans from the village believed in Jesus because the woman had said, “He told me everything I ever did!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they came out to see him, they begged him to stay in their village. So he stayed for two days,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: long enough for many more to hear his message and believe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they said to the woman, “Now we believe, not just because of what you told us, but because we have heard him ourselves. Now we know that he is indeed the Savior of the world.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the end of the two days, Jesus went on to Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He himself had said that a prophet is not honored in his own hometown.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet the Galileans welcomed him, for they had been in Jerusalem at the Passover celebration and had seen everything he did there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he traveled through Galilee, he came to Cana, where he had turned the water into wine. There was a government official in nearby Capernaum whose son was very sick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he heard that Jesus had come from Judea to Galilee, he went and begged Jesus to come to Capernaum to heal his son, who was about to die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus asked, “Will you never believe in me unless you see miraculous signs and wonders?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The official pleaded, “Lord, please come now before my little boy dies.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus told him, “Go back home. Your son will live!” And the man believed what Jesus said and started home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While the man was on his way, some of his servants met him with the news that his son was alive and well.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He asked them when the boy had begun to get better, and they replied, “Yesterday afternoon at one o’clock his fever suddenly disappeared!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the father realized that that was the very time Jesus had told him, “Your son will live.” And he and his entire household believed in Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was the second miraculous sign Jesus did in Galilee after coming from Judea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterward Jesus returned to Jerusalem for one of the Jewish holy days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Inside the city, near the Sheep Gate, was the pool of Bethesda, with five covered porches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Crowds of sick people—blind, lame, or paralyzed—lay on the porches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of the men lying there had been sick for thirty-eight years.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus saw him and knew he had been ill for a long time, he asked him, “Would you like to get well?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I can’t, sir,” the sick man said, “for I have no one to put me into the pool when the water bubbles up. Someone else always gets there ahead of me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told him, “Stand up, pick up your mat, and walk!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Instantly, the man was healed! He rolled up his sleeping mat and began walking! But this miracle happened on the Sabbath,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so the Jewish leaders objected. They said to the man who was cured, “You can’t work on the Sabbath! The law doesn’t allow you to carry that sleeping mat!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he replied, “The man who healed me told me, ‘Pick up your mat and walk.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Who said such a thing as that?” they demanded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man didn’t know, for Jesus had disappeared into the crowd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But afterward Jesus found him in the Temple and told him, “Now you are well; so stop sinning, or something even worse may happen to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the man went and told the Jewish leaders that it was Jesus who had healed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Jewish leaders began harassing Jesus for breaking the Sabbath rules.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus replied, “My Father is always working, and so am I.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the Jewish leaders tried all the harder to find a way to kill him. For he not only broke the Sabbath, he called God his Father, thereby making himself equal with God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus explained, “I tell you the truth, the Son can do nothing by himself. He does only what he sees the Father doing. Whatever the Father does, the Son also does.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Father loves the Son and shows him everything he is doing. In fact, the Father will show him how to do even greater works than healing this man. Then you will truly be astonished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For just as the Father gives life to those he raises from the dead, so the Son gives life to anyone he wants.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In addition, the Father judges no one. Instead, he has given the Son absolute authority to judge,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that everyone will honor the Son, just as they honor the Father. Anyone who does not honor the Son is certainly not honoring the Father who sent him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I tell you the truth, those who listen to my message and believe in God who sent me have eternal life. They will never be condemned for their sins, but they have already passed from death into life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And I assure you that the time is coming, indeed it’s here now, when the dead will hear my voice—the voice of the Son of God. And those who listen will live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Father has life in himself, and he has granted that same life-giving power to his Son.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he has given him authority to judge everyone because he is the Son of Man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t be so surprised! Indeed, the time is coming when all the dead in their graves will hear the voice of God’s Son,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and they will rise again. Those who have done good will rise to experience eternal life, and those who have continued in evil will rise to experience judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I can do nothing on my own. I judge as God tells me. Therefore, my judgment is just, because I carry out the will of the one who sent me, not my own will.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If I were to testify on my own behalf, my testimony would not be valid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But someone else is also testifying about me, and I assure you that everything he says about me is true.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In fact, you sent investigators to listen to John the Baptist, and his testimony about me was true.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of course, I have no need of human witnesses, but I say these things so you might be saved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: John was like a burning and shining lamp, and you were excited for a while about his message.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I have a greater witness than John—my teachings and my miracles. The Father gave me these works to accomplish, and they prove that he sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the Father who sent me has testified about me himself. You have never heard his voice or seen him face to face,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and you do not have his message in your hearts, because you do not believe me—the one he sent to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You search the Scriptures because you think they give you eternal life. But the Scriptures point to me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet you refuse to come to me to receive this life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Your approval means nothing to me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because I know you don’t have God’s love within you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I have come to you in my Father’s name, and you have rejected me. Yet if others come in their own name, you gladly welcome them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No wonder you can’t believe! For you gladly honor each other, but you don’t care about the honor that comes from the one who alone is God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Yet it isn’t I who will accuse you before the Father. Moses will accuse you! Yes, Moses, in whom you put your hopes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you really believed Moses, you would believe me, because he wrote about me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But since you don’t believe what he wrote, how will you believe what I say?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this, Jesus crossed over to the far side of the Sea of Galilee, also known as the Sea of Tiberias.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A huge crowd kept following him wherever he went, because they saw his miraculous signs as he healed the sick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus climbed a hill and sat down with his disciples around him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (It was nearly time for the Jewish Passover celebration.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus soon saw a huge crowd of people coming to look for him. Turning to Philip, he asked, “Where can we buy bread to feed all these people?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was testing Philip, for he already knew what he was going to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Philip replied, “Even if we worked for months, we wouldn’t have enough money to feed them!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Andrew, Simon Peter’s brother, spoke up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “There’s a young boy here with five barley loaves and two fish. But what good is that with this huge crowd?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Tell everyone to sit down,” Jesus said. So they all sat down on the grassy slopes. (The men alone numbered about 5,000.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus took the loaves, gave thanks to God, and distributed them to the people. Afterward he did the same with the fish. And they all ate as much as they wanted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After everyone was full, Jesus told his disciples, “Now gather the leftovers, so that nothing is wasted.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they picked up the pieces and filled twelve baskets with scraps left by the people who had eaten from the five barley loaves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the people saw him do this miraculous sign, they exclaimed, “Surely, he is the Prophet we have been expecting!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus saw that they were ready to force him to be their king, he slipped away into the hills by himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That evening Jesus’ disciples went down to the shore to wait for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But as darkness fell and Jesus still hadn’t come back, they got into the boat and headed across the lake toward Capernaum.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Soon a gale swept down upon them, and the sea grew very rough.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They had rowed three or four miles when suddenly they saw Jesus walking on the water toward the boat. They were terrified,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but he called out to them, “Don’t be afraid. I am here!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they were eager to let him in the boat, and immediately they arrived at their destination!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day the crowd that had stayed on the far shore saw that the disciples had taken the only boat, and they realized Jesus had not gone with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Several boats from Tiberias landed near the place where the Lord had blessed the bread and the people had eaten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when the crowd saw that neither Jesus nor his disciples were there, they got into the boats and went across to Capernaum to look for him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They found him on the other side of the lake and asked, “Rabbi, when did you get here?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “I tell you the truth, you want to be with me because I fed you, not because you understood the miraculous signs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But don’t be so concerned about perishable things like food. Spend your energy seeking the eternal life that the Son of Man can give you. For God the Father has given me the seal of his approval.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They replied, “We want to perform God’s works, too. What should we do?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told them, “This is the only work God wants from you: Believe in the one he has sent.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They answered, “Show us a miraculous sign if you want us to believe in you. What can you do?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After all, our ancestors ate manna while they journeyed through the wilderness! The Scriptures say, ‘Moses gave them bread from heaven to eat.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “I tell you the truth, Moses didn’t give you bread from heaven. My Father did. And now he offers you the true bread from heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The true bread of God is the one who comes down from heaven and gives life to the world.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Sir,” they said, “give us that bread every day.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “I am the bread of life. Whoever comes to me will never be hungry again. Whoever believes in me will never be thirsty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you haven’t believed in me even though you have seen me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, those the Father has given me will come to me, and I will never reject them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I have come down from heaven to do the will of God who sent me, not to do my own will.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this is the will of God, that I should not lose even one of all those he has given me, but that I should raise them up at the last day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is my Father’s will that all who see his Son and believe in him should have eternal life. I will raise them up at the last day.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the people began to murmur in disagreement because he had said, “I am the bread that came down from heaven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They said, “Isn’t this Jesus, the son of Joseph? We know his father and mother. How can he say, ‘I came down from heaven’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus replied, “Stop complaining about what I said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For no one can come to me unless the Father who sent me draws them to me, and at the last day I will raise them up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As it is written in the Scriptures, ‘They will all be taught by God.’ Everyone who listens to the Father and learns from him comes to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (Not that anyone has ever seen the Father; only I, who was sent from God, have seen him.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I tell you the truth, anyone who believes has eternal life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yes, I am the bread of life!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your ancestors ate manna in the wilderness, but they all died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone who eats the bread from heaven, however, will never die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am the living bread that came down from heaven. Anyone who eats this bread will live forever; and this bread, which I will offer so the world may live, is my flesh.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the people began arguing with each other about what he meant. “How can this man give us his flesh to eat?” they asked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus said again, “I tell you the truth, unless you eat the flesh of the Son of Man and drink his blood, you cannot have eternal life within you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But anyone who eats my flesh and drinks my blood has eternal life, and I will raise that person at the last day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For my flesh is true food, and my blood is true drink.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone who eats my flesh and drinks my blood remains in me, and I in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I live because of the living Father who sent me; in the same way, anyone who feeds on me will live because of me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am the true bread that came down from heaven. Anyone who eats this bread will not die as your ancestors did (even though they ate the manna) but will live forever.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said these things while he was teaching in the synagogue in Capernaum.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many of his disciples said, “This is very hard to understand. How can anyone accept it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus was aware that his disciples were complaining, so he said to them, “Does this offend you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then what will you think if you see the Son of Man ascend to heaven again?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Spirit alone gives eternal life. Human effort accomplishes nothing. And the very words I have spoken to you are spirit and life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But some of you do not believe me.” (For Jesus knew from the beginning which ones didn’t believe, and he knew who would betray him.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said, “That is why I said that people can’t come to me unless the Father gives them to me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At this point many of his disciples turned away and deserted him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus turned to the Twelve and asked, “Are you also going to leave?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon Peter replied, “Lord, to whom would we go? You have the words that give eternal life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We believe, and we know you are the Holy One of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said, “I chose the twelve of you, but one is a devil.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was speaking of Judas, son of Simon Iscariot, one of the Twelve, who would later betray him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this, Jesus traveled around Galilee. He wanted to stay out of Judea, where the Jewish leaders were plotting his death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But soon it was time for the Jewish Festival of Shelters,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and Jesus’ brothers said to him, “Leave here and go to Judea, where your followers can see your miracles!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You can’t become famous if you hide like this! If you can do such wonderful things, show yourself to the world!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For even his brothers didn’t believe in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “Now is not the right time for me to go, but you can go anytime.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The world can’t hate you, but it does hate me because I accuse it of doing evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You go on. I’m not going to this festival, because my time has not yet come.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After saying these things, Jesus remained in Galilee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But after his brothers left for the festival, Jesus also went, though secretly, staying out of public view.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jewish leaders tried to find him at the festival and kept asking if anyone had seen him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There was a lot of grumbling about him among the crowds. Some argued, “He’s a good man,” but others said, “He’s nothing but a fraud who deceives the people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But no one had the courage to speak favorably about him in public, for they were afraid of getting in trouble with the Jewish leaders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then, midway through the festival, Jesus went up to the Temple and began to teach.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people were surprised when they heard him. “How does he know so much when he hasn’t been trained?” they asked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus told them, “My message is not my own; it comes from God who sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone who wants to do the will of God will know whether my teaching is from God or is merely my own.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who speak for themselves want glory only for themselves, but a person who seeks to honor the one who sent him speaks truth, not lies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moses gave you the law, but none of you obeys it! In fact, you are trying to kill me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The crowd replied, “You’re demon possessed! Who’s trying to kill you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “I did one miracle on the Sabbath, and you were amazed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you work on the Sabbath, too, when you obey Moses’ law of circumcision. (Actually, this tradition of circumcision began with the patriarchs, long before the law of Moses.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if the correct time for circumcising your son falls on the Sabbath, you go ahead and do it so as not to break the law of Moses. So why should you be angry with me for healing a man on the Sabbath?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look beneath the surface so you can judge correctly.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of the people who lived in Jerusalem started to ask each other, “Isn’t this the man they are trying to kill?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But here he is, speaking in public, and they say nothing to him. Could our leaders possibly believe that he is the Messiah?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But how could he be? For we know where this man comes from. When the Messiah comes, he will simply appear; no one will know where he comes from.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While Jesus was teaching in the Temple, he called out, “Yes, you know me, and you know where I come from. But I’m not here on my own. The one who sent me is true, and you don’t know him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I know him because I come from him, and he sent me to you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the leaders tried to arrest him; but no one laid a hand on him, because his time had not yet come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many among the crowds at the Temple believed in him. “After all,” they said, “would you expect the Messiah to do more miraculous signs than this man has done?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Pharisees heard that the crowds were whispering such things, they and the leading priests sent Temple guards to arrest Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus told them, “I will be with you only a little longer. Then I will return to the one who sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will search for me but not find me. And you cannot go where I am going.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jewish leaders were puzzled by this statement. “Where is he planning to go?” they asked. “Is he thinking of leaving the country and going to the Jews in other lands? Maybe he will even teach the Greeks!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What does he mean when he says, ‘You will search for me but not find me,’ and ‘You cannot go where I am going’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: On the last day, the climax of the festival, Jesus stood and shouted to the crowds, “Anyone who is thirsty may come to me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone who believes in me may come and drink! For the Scriptures declare, ‘Rivers of living water will flow from his heart.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (When he said “living water,” he was speaking of the Spirit, who would be given to everyone believing in him. But the Spirit had not yet been given, because Jesus had not yet entered into his glory.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the crowds heard him say this, some of them declared, “Surely this man is the Prophet we’ve been expecting.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Others said, “He is the Messiah.” Still others said, “But he can’t be! Will the Messiah come from Galilee?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the Scriptures clearly state that the Messiah will be born of the royal line of David, in Bethlehem, the village where King David was born.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the crowd was divided about him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some even wanted him arrested, but no one laid a hand on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Temple guards returned without having arrested Jesus, the leading priests and Pharisees demanded, “Why didn’t you bring him in?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “We have never heard anyone speak like this!” the guards responded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Have you been led astray, too?” the Pharisees mocked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Is there a single one of us rulers or Pharisees who believes in him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This foolish crowd follows him, but they are ignorant of the law. God’s curse is on them!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Nicodemus, the leader who had met with Jesus earlier, spoke up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Is it legal to convict a man before he is given a hearing?” he asked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They replied, “Are you from Galilee, too? Search the Scriptures and see for yourself—no prophet ever comes from Galilee!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the meeting broke up, and everybody went home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus returned to the Mount of Olives,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but early the next morning he was back again at the Temple. A crowd soon gathered, and he sat down and taught them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he was speaking, the teachers of religious law and the Pharisees brought a woman who had been caught in the act of adultery. They put her in front of the crowd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Teacher,” they said to Jesus, “this woman was caught in the act of adultery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The law of Moses says to stone her. What do you say?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were trying to trap him into saying something they could use against him, but Jesus stooped down and wrote in the dust with his finger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They kept demanding an answer, so he stood up again and said, “All right, but let the one who has never sinned throw the first stone!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he stooped down again and wrote in the dust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the accusers heard this, they slipped away one by one, beginning with the oldest, until only Jesus was left in the middle of the crowd with the woman.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus stood up again and said to the woman, “Where are your accusers? Didn’t even one of them condemn you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“No, Lord,” she said.
And Jesus said, “Neither do I. Go and sin no more.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus spoke to the people once more and said, “I am the light of the world. If you follow me, you won’t have to walk in darkness, because you will have the light that leads to life.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees replied, “You are making those claims about yourself! Such testimony is not valid.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told them, “These claims are valid even though I make them about myself. For I know where I came from and where I am going, but you don’t know this about me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You judge me by human standards, but I do not judge anyone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And if I did, my judgment would be correct in every respect because I am not alone. The Father who sent me is with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your own law says that if two people agree about something, their witness is accepted as fact.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am one witness, and my Father who sent me is the other.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Where is your father?” they asked.
Jesus answered, “Since you don’t know who I am, you don’t know who my Father is. If you knew me, you would also know my Father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus made these statements while he was teaching in the section of the Temple known as the Treasury. But he was not arrested, because his time had not yet come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Later Jesus said to them again, “I am going away. You will search for me but will die in your sin. You cannot come where I am going.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people asked, “Is he planning to commit suicide? What does he mean, ‘You cannot come where I am going’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus continued, “You are from below; I am from above. You belong to this world; I do not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That is why I said that you will die in your sins; for unless you believe that I am who I claim to be, you will die in your sins.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Who are you?” they demanded.
Jesus replied, “The one I have always claimed to be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have much to say about you and much to condemn, but I won’t. For I say only what I have heard from the one who sent me, and he is completely truthful.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they still didn’t understand that he was talking about his Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jesus said, “When you have lifted up the Son of Man on the cross, then you will understand that I am he. I do nothing on my own but say only what the Father taught me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the one who sent me is with me—he has not deserted me. For I always do what pleases him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then many who heard him say these things believed in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said to the people who believed in him, “You are truly my disciples if you remain faithful to my teachings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you will know the truth, and the truth will set you free.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But we are descendants of Abraham,” they said. “We have never been slaves to anyone. What do you mean, ‘You will be set free’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “I tell you the truth, everyone who sins is a slave of sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A slave is not a permanent member of the family, but a son is part of the family forever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So if the Son sets you free, you are truly free.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yes, I realize that you are descendants of Abraham. And yet some of you are trying to kill me because there’s no room in your hearts for my message.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am telling you what I saw when I was with my Father. But you are following the advice of your father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Our father is Abraham!” they declared.
“No,” Jesus replied, “for if you were really the children of Abraham, you would follow his example.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Instead, you are trying to kill me because I told you the truth, which I heard from God. Abraham never did such a thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
No, you are imitating your real father.”
They replied, “We aren’t illegitimate children! God himself is our true Father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told them, “If God were your Father, you would love me, because I have come to you from God. I am not here on my own, but he sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why can’t you understand what I am saying? It’s because you can’t even hear me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you are the children of your father the devil, and you love to do the evil things he does. He was a murderer from the beginning. He has always hated the truth, because there is no truth in him. When he lies, it is consistent with his character; for he is a liar and the father of lies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So when I tell the truth, you just naturally don’t believe me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Which of you can truthfully accuse me of sin? And since I am telling you the truth, why don’t you believe me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone who belongs to God listens gladly to the words of God. But you don’t listen because you don’t belong to God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people retorted, “You Samaritan devil! Didn’t we say all along that you were possessed by a demon?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “No,” Jesus said, “I have no demon in me. For I honor my Father—and you dishonor me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And though I have no wish to glorify myself, God is going to glorify me. He is the true judge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you the truth, anyone who obeys my teaching will never die!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people said, “Now we know you are possessed by a demon. Even Abraham and the prophets died, but you say, ‘Anyone who obeys my teaching will never die!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are you greater than our father Abraham? He died, and so did the prophets. Who do you think you are?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “If I want glory for myself, it doesn’t count. But it is my Father who will glorify me. You say, ‘He is our God,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but you don’t even know him. I know him. If I said otherwise, I would be as great a liar as you! But I do know him and obey him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your father Abraham rejoiced as he looked forward to my coming. He saw it and was glad.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people said, “You aren’t even fifty years old. How can you say you have seen Abraham?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “I tell you the truth, before Abraham was even born, I am!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that point they picked up stones to throw at him. But Jesus was hidden from them and left the Temple.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Jesus was walking along, he saw a man who had been blind from birth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Rabbi,” his disciples asked him, “why was this man born blind? Was it because of his own sins or his parents’ sins?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “It was not because of his sins or his parents’ sins,” Jesus answered. “This happened so the power of God could be seen in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We must quickly carry out the tasks assigned us by the one who sent us. The night is coming, and then no one can work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But while I am here in the world, I am the light of the world.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he spit on the ground, made mud with the saliva, and spread the mud over the blind man’s eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told him, “Go wash yourself in the pool of Siloam” (Siloam means “sent”). So the man went and washed and came back seeing!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His neighbors and others who knew him as a blind beggar asked each other, “Isn’t this the man who used to sit and beg?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Some said he was, and others said, “No, he just looks like him!”
But the beggar kept saying, “Yes, I am the same one!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They asked, “Who healed you? What happened?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He told them, “The man they call Jesus made mud and spread it over my eyes and told me, ‘Go to the pool of Siloam and wash yourself.’ So I went and washed, and now I can see!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Where is he now?” they asked.
“I don’t know,” he replied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they took the man who had been blind to the Pharisees,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because it was on the Sabbath that Jesus had made the mud and healed him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Pharisees asked the man all about it. So he told them, “He put the mud over my eyes, and when I washed it away, I could see!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of the Pharisees said, “This man Jesus is not from God, for he is working on the Sabbath.” Others said, “But how could an ordinary sinner do such miraculous signs?” So there was a deep division of opinion among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the Pharisees again questioned the man who had been blind and demanded, “What’s your opinion about this man who healed you?”
The man replied, “I think he must be a prophet.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jewish leaders still refused to believe the man had been blind and could now see, so they called in his parents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They asked them, “Is this your son? Was he born blind? If so, how can he now see?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His parents replied, “We know this is our son and that he was born blind,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but we don’t know how he can see or who healed him. Ask him. He is old enough to speak for himself.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His parents said this because they were afraid of the Jewish leaders, who had announced that anyone saying Jesus was the Messiah would be expelled from the synagogue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That’s why they said, “He is old enough. Ask him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So for the second time they called in the man who had been blind and told him, “God should get the glory for this, because we know this man Jesus is a sinner.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I don’t know whether he is a sinner,” the man replied. “But I know this: I was blind, and now I can see!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But what did he do?” they asked. “How did he heal you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Look!” the man exclaimed. “I told you once. Didn’t you listen? Why do you want to hear it again? Do you want to become his disciples, too?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they cursed him and said, “You are his disciple, but we are disciples of Moses!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We know God spoke to Moses, but we don’t even know where this man comes from.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why, that’s very strange!” the man replied. “He healed my eyes, and yet you don’t know where he comes from?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We know that God doesn’t listen to sinners, but he is ready to hear those who worship him and do his will.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Ever since the world began, no one has been able to open the eyes of someone born blind.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If this man were not from God, he couldn’t have done it.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You were born a total sinner!” they answered. “Are you trying to teach us?” And they threw him out of the synagogue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus heard what had happened, he found the man and asked, “Do you believe in the Son of Man?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The man answered, “Who is he, sir? I want to believe in him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “You have seen him,” Jesus said, “and he is speaking to you!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Yes, Lord, I believe!” the man said. And he worshiped Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus told him, “I entered this world to render judgment—to give sight to the blind and to show those who think they see that they are blind.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some Pharisees who were standing nearby heard him and asked, “Are you saying we’re blind?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you were blind, you wouldn’t be guilty,” Jesus replied. “But you remain guilty because you claim you can see.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I tell you the truth, anyone who sneaks over the wall of a sheepfold, rather than going through the gate, must surely be a thief and a robber!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the one who enters through the gate is the shepherd of the sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The gatekeeper opens the gate for him, and the sheep recognize his voice and come to him. He calls his own sheep by name and leads them out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After he has gathered his own flock, he walks ahead of them, and they follow him because they know his voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They won’t follow a stranger; they will run from him because they don’t know his voice.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who heard Jesus use this illustration didn’t understand what he meant,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so he explained it to them: “I tell you the truth, I am the gate for the sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All who came before me were thieves and robbers. But the true sheep did not listen to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yes, I am the gate. Those who come in through me will be saved. They will come and go freely and will find good pastures.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The thief’s purpose is to steal and kill and destroy. My purpose is to give them a rich and satisfying life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I am the good shepherd. The good shepherd sacrifices his life for the sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A hired hand will run when he sees a wolf coming. He will abandon the sheep because they don’t belong to him and he isn’t their shepherd. And so the wolf attacks them and scatters the flock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The hired hand runs away because he’s working only for the money and doesn’t really care about the sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I am the good shepherd; I know my own sheep, and they know me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: just as my Father knows me and I know the Father. So I sacrifice my life for the sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have other sheep, too, that are not in this sheepfold. I must bring them also. They will listen to my voice, and there will be one flock with one shepherd.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The Father loves me because I sacrifice my life so I may take it back again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No one can take my life from me. I sacrifice it voluntarily. For I have the authority to lay it down when I want to and also to take it up again. For this is what my Father has commanded.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When he said these things, the people were again divided in their opinions about him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some said, “He’s demon possessed and out of his mind. Why listen to a man like that?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Others said, “This doesn’t sound like a man possessed by a demon! Can a demon open the eyes of the blind?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was now winter, and Jesus was in Jerusalem at the time of Hanukkah, the Festival of Dedication.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He was in the Temple, walking through the section known as Solomon’s Colonnade.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people surrounded him and asked, “How long are you going to keep us in suspense? If you are the Messiah, tell us plainly.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “I have already told you, and you don’t believe me. The proof is the work I do in my Father’s name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you don’t believe me because you are not my sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: My sheep listen to my voice; I know them, and they follow me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I give them eternal life, and they will never perish. No one can snatch them away from me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for my Father has given them to me, and he is more powerful than anyone else. No one can snatch them from the Father’s hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Father and I are one.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Once again the people picked up stones to kill him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said, “At my Father’s direction I have done many good works. For which one are you going to stone me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They replied, “We’re stoning you not for any good work, but for blasphemy! You, a mere man, claim to be God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “It is written in your own Scriptures that God said to certain leaders of the people, ‘I say, you are gods!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you know that the Scriptures cannot be altered. So if those people who received God’s message were called ‘gods,’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: why do you call it blasphemy when I say, ‘I am the Son of God’? After all, the Father set me apart and sent me into the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t believe me unless I carry out my Father’s work.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if I do his work, believe in the evidence of the miraculous works I have done, even if you don’t believe me. Then you will know and understand that the Father is in me, and I am in the Father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Once again they tried to arrest him, but he got away and left them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He went beyond the Jordan River near the place where John was first baptizing and stayed there awhile.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And many followed him. “John didn’t perform miraculous signs,” they remarked to one another, “but everything he said about this man has come true.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And many who were there believed in Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A man named Lazarus was sick. He lived in Bethany with his sisters, Mary and Martha.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the Mary who later poured the expensive perfume on the Lord’s feet and wiped them with her hair. Her brother, Lazarus, was sick.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the two sisters sent a message to Jesus telling him, “Lord, your dear friend is very sick.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when Jesus heard about it he said, “Lazarus’s sickness will not end in death. No, it happened for the glory of God so that the Son of God will receive glory from this.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So although Jesus loved Martha, Mary, and Lazarus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: he stayed where he was for the next two days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Finally, he said to his disciples, “Let’s go back to Judea.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But his disciples objected. “Rabbi,” they said, “only a few days ago the people in Judea were trying to stone you. Are you going there again?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “There are twelve hours of daylight every day. During the day people can walk safely. They can see because they have the light of this world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But at night there is danger of stumbling because they have no light.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said, “Our friend Lazarus has fallen asleep, but now I will go and wake him up.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples said, “Lord, if he is sleeping, he will soon get better!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They thought Jesus meant Lazarus was simply sleeping, but Jesus meant Lazarus had died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he told them plainly, “Lazarus is dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And for your sakes, I’m glad I wasn’t there, for now you will really believe. Come, let’s go see him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thomas, nicknamed the Twin, said to his fellow disciples, “Let’s go, too—and die with Jesus.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus arrived at Bethany, he was told that Lazarus had already been in his grave for four days.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Bethany was only a few miles down the road from Jerusalem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and many of the people had come to console Martha and Mary in their loss.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Martha got word that Jesus was coming, she went to meet him. But Mary stayed in the house.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Martha said to Jesus, “Lord, if only you had been here, my brother would not have died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But even now I know that God will give you whatever you ask.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told her, “Your brother will rise again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Yes,” Martha said, “he will rise when everyone else rises, at the last day.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told her, “I am the resurrection and the life. Anyone who believes in me will live, even after dying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Everyone who lives in me and believes in me will never ever die. Do you believe this, Martha?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Yes, Lord,” she told him. “I have always believed you are the Messiah, the Son of God, the one who has come into the world from God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then she returned to Mary. She called Mary aside from the mourners and told her, “The Teacher is here and wants to see you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Mary immediately went to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus had stayed outside the village, at the place where Martha met him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the people who were at the house consoling Mary saw her leave so hastily, they assumed she was going to Lazarus’s grave to weep. So they followed her there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Mary arrived and saw Jesus, she fell at his feet and said, “Lord, if only you had been here, my brother would not have died.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus saw her weeping and saw the other people wailing with her, a deep anger welled up within him, and he was deeply troubled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Where have you put him?” he asked them.
They told him, “Lord, come and see.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus wept.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The people who were standing nearby said, “See how much he loved him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But some said, “This man healed a blind man. Couldn’t he have kept Lazarus from dying?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus was still angry as he arrived at the tomb, a cave with a stone rolled across its entrance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Roll the stone aside,” Jesus told them.
But Martha, the dead man’s sister, protested, “Lord, he has been dead for four days. The smell will be terrible.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus responded, “Didn’t I tell you that you would see God’s glory if you believe?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they rolled the stone aside. Then Jesus looked up to heaven and said, “Father, thank you for hearing me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You always hear me, but I said it out loud for the sake of all these people standing here, so that they will believe you sent me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus shouted, “Lazarus, come out!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And the dead man came out, his hands and feet bound in graveclothes, his face wrapped in a headcloth. Jesus told them, “Unwrap him and let him go!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many of the people who were with Mary believed in Jesus when they saw this happen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But some went to the Pharisees and told them what Jesus had done.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the leading priests and Pharisees called the high council together. “What are we going to do?” they asked each other. “This man certainly performs many miraculous signs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If we allow him to go on like this, soon everyone will believe in him. Then the Roman army will come and destroy both our Temple and our nation.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Caiaphas, who was high priest at that time, said, “You don’t know what you’re talking about!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You don’t realize that it’s better for you that one man should die for the people than for the whole nation to be destroyed.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He did not say this on his own; as high priest at that time he was led to prophesy that Jesus would die for the entire nation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And not only for that nation, but to bring together and unite all the children of God scattered around the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So from that time on, the Jewish leaders began to plot Jesus’ death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As a result, Jesus stopped his public ministry among the people and left Jerusalem. He went to a place near the wilderness, to the village of Ephraim, and stayed there with his disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was now almost time for the Jewish Passover celebration, and many people from all over the country arrived in Jerusalem several days early so they could go through the purification ceremony before Passover began.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They kept looking for Jesus, but as they stood around in the Temple, they said to each other, “What do you think? He won’t come for Passover, will he?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Meanwhile, the leading priests and Pharisees had publicly ordered that anyone seeing Jesus must report it immediately so they could arrest him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Six days before the Passover celebration began, Jesus arrived in Bethany, the home of Lazarus—the man he had raised from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A dinner was prepared in Jesus’ honor. Martha served, and Lazarus was among those who ate with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Mary took a twelve-ounce jar of expensive perfume made from essence of nard, and she anointed Jesus’ feet with it, wiping his feet with her hair. The house was filled with the fragrance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Judas Iscariot, the disciple who would soon betray him, said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “That perfume was worth a year’s wages. It should have been sold and the money given to the poor.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Not that he cared for the poor—he was a thief, and since he was in charge of the disciples’ money, he often stole some for himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “Leave her alone. She did this in preparation for my burial.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You will always have the poor among you, but you will not always have me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When all the people heard of Jesus’ arrival, they flocked to see him and also to see Lazarus, the man Jesus had raised from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the leading priests decided to kill Lazarus, too,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for it was because of him that many of the people had deserted them and believed in Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The next day, the news that Jesus was on the way to Jerusalem swept through the city. A large crowd of Passover visitors
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
took palm branches and went down the road to meet him. They shouted, 
“Praise God!
Blessings on the one who comes in the name of the Lord!
Hail to the King of Israel!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus found a young donkey and rode on it, fulfilling the prophecy that said:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Don’t be afraid, people of Jerusalem.
Look, your King is coming,
    riding on a donkey’s colt.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His disciples didn’t understand at the time that this was a fulfillment of prophecy. But after Jesus entered into his glory, they remembered what had happened and realized that these things had been written about him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many in the crowd had seen Jesus call Lazarus from the tomb, raising him from the dead, and they were telling others about it.
verses.speaker: Narrator
