verses.text: That was the reason so many went out to meet him—because they had heard about this miraculous sign.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the Pharisees said to each other, “There’s nothing we can do. Look, everyone has gone after him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some Greeks who had come to Jerusalem for the Passover celebration
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: paid a visit to Philip, who was from Bethsaida in Galilee. They said, “Sir, we want to meet Jesus.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Philip told Andrew about it, and they went together to ask Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “Now the time has come for the Son of Man to enter into his glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you the truth, unless a kernel of wheat is planted in the soil and dies, it remains alone. But its death will produce many new kernels—a plentiful harvest of new lives.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who love their life in this world will lose it. Those who care nothing for their life in this world will keep it for eternity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone who wants to serve me must follow me, because my servants must be where I am. And the Father will honor anyone who serves me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now my soul is deeply troubled. Should I pray, ‘Father, save me from this hour’? But this is the very reason I came!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Father, bring glory to your name.”
Then a voice spoke from heaven, saying, “I have already brought glory to my name, and I will do so again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the crowd heard the voice, some thought it was thunder, while others declared an angel had spoken to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus told them, “The voice was for your benefit, not mine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The time for judging this world has come, when Satan, the ruler of this world, will be cast out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when I am lifted up from the earth, I will draw everyone to myself.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He said this to indicate how he was going to die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The crowd responded, “We understood from Scripture that the Messiah would live forever. How can you say the Son of Man will die? Just who is this Son of Man, anyway?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “My light will shine for you just a little longer. Walk in the light while you can, so the darkness will not overtake you. Those who walk in the darkness cannot see where they are going.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Put your trust in the light while there is still time; then you will become children of the light.”
After saying these things, Jesus went away and was hidden from them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But despite all the miraculous signs Jesus had done, most of the people still did not believe in him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is exactly what Isaiah the prophet had predicted: 
“Lord, who has believed our message?
    To whom has the Lord revealed his powerful arm?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the people couldn’t believe, for as Isaiah also said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The Lord has blinded their eyes
    and hardened their hearts—
so that their eyes cannot see,
    and their hearts cannot understand,
and they cannot turn to me
    and have me heal them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Isaiah was referring to Jesus when he said this, because he saw the future and spoke of the Messiah’s glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Many people did believe in him, however, including some of the Jewish leaders. But they wouldn’t admit it for fear that the Pharisees would expel them from the synagogue.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For they loved human praise more than the praise of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus shouted to the crowds, “If you trust me, you are trusting not only me, but also God who sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For when you see me, you are seeing the one who sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have come as a light to shine in this dark world, so that all who put their trust in me will no longer remain in the dark.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will not judge those who hear me but don’t obey me, for I have come to save the world and not to judge it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But all who reject me and my message will be judged on the day of judgment by the truth I have spoken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I don’t speak on my own authority. The Father who sent me has commanded me what to say and how to say it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I know his commands lead to eternal life; so I say whatever the Father tells me to say.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Before the Passover celebration, Jesus knew that his hour had come to leave this world and return to his Father. He had loved his disciples during his ministry on earth, and now he loved them to the very end.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was time for supper, and the devil had already prompted Judas, son of Simon Iscariot, to betray Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus knew that the Father had given him authority over everything and that he had come from God and would return to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So he got up from the table, took off his robe, wrapped a towel around his waist,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and poured water into a basin. Then he began to wash the disciples’ feet, drying them with the towel he had around him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus came to Simon Peter, Peter said to him, “Lord, are you going to wash my feet?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “You don’t understand now what I am doing, but someday you will.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“No,” Peter protested, “you will never ever wash my feet!”
Jesus replied, “Unless I wash you, you won’t belong to me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon Peter exclaimed, “Then wash my hands and head as well, Lord, not just my feet!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “A person who has bathed all over does not need to wash, except for the feet, to be entirely clean. And you disciples are clean, but not all of you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For Jesus knew who would betray him. That is what he meant when he said, “Not all of you are clean.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After washing their feet, he put on his robe again and sat down and asked, “Do you understand what I was doing?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You call me ‘Teacher’ and ‘Lord,’ and you are right, because that’s what I am.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And since I, your Lord and Teacher, have washed your feet, you ought to wash each other’s feet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have given you an example to follow. Do as I have done to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you the truth, slaves are not greater than their master. Nor is the messenger more important than the one who sends the message.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now that you know these things, God will bless you for doing them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I am not saying these things to all of you; I know the ones I have chosen. But this fulfills the Scripture that says, ‘The one who eats my food has turned against me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you this beforehand, so that when it happens you will believe that I am the Messiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you the truth, anyone who welcomes my messenger is welcoming me, and anyone who welcomes me is welcoming the Father who sent me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Jesus was deeply troubled, and he exclaimed, “I tell you the truth, one of you will betray me!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples looked at each other, wondering whom he could mean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciple Jesus loved was sitting next to Jesus at the table.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon Peter motioned to him to ask, “Who’s he talking about?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So that disciple leaned over to Jesus and asked, “Lord, who is it?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus responded, “It is the one to whom I give the bread I dip in the bowl.” And when he had dipped it, he gave it to Judas, son of Simon Iscariot.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Judas had eaten the bread, Satan entered into him. Then Jesus told him, “Hurry and do what you’re going to do.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: None of the others at the table knew what Jesus meant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since Judas was their treasurer, some thought Jesus was telling him to go and pay for the food or to give some money to the poor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Judas left at once, going out into the night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As soon as Judas left the room, Jesus said, “The time has come for the Son of Man to enter into his glory, and God will be glorified because of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And since God receives glory because of the Son, he will give his own glory to the Son, and he will do so at once.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Dear children, I will be with you only a little longer. And as I told the Jewish leaders, you will search for me, but you can’t come where I am going.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So now I am giving you a new commandment: Love each other. Just as I have loved you, you should love each other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Your love for one another will prove to the world that you are my disciples.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Simon Peter asked, “Lord, where are you going?”
And Jesus replied, “You can’t go with me now, but you will follow me later.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But why can’t I come now, Lord?” he asked. “I’m ready to die for you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “Die for me? I tell you the truth, Peter—before the rooster crows tomorrow morning, you will deny three times that you even know me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Don’t let your hearts be troubled. Trust in God, and trust also in me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is more than enough room in my Father’s home. If this were not so, would I have told you that I am going to prepare a place for you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When everything is ready, I will come and get you, so that you will always be with me where I am.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you know the way to where I am going.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “No, we don’t know, Lord,” Thomas said. “We have no idea where you are going, so how can we know the way?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus told him, “I am the way, the truth, and the life. No one can come to the Father except through me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you had really known me, you would know who my Father is. From now on, you do know him and have seen him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Philip said, “Lord, show us the Father, and we will be satisfied.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “Have I been with you all this time, Philip, and yet you still don’t know who I am? Anyone who has seen me has seen the Father! So why are you asking me to show him to you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Don’t you believe that I am in the Father and the Father is in me? The words I speak are not my own, but my Father who lives in me does his work through me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just believe that I am in the Father and the Father is in me. Or at least believe because of the work you have seen me do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I tell you the truth, anyone who believes in me will do the same works I have done, and even greater works, because I am going to be with the Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You can ask for anything in my name, and I will do it, so that the Son can bring glory to the Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yes, ask me for anything in my name, and I will do it!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If you love me, obey my commandments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I will ask the Father, and he will give you another Advocate, who will never leave you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He is the Holy Spirit, who leads into all truth. The world cannot receive him, because it isn’t looking for him and doesn’t recognize him. But you know him, because he lives with you now and later will be in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: No, I will not abandon you as orphans—I will come to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Soon the world will no longer see me, but you will see me. Since I live, you also will live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I am raised to life again, you will know that I am in my Father, and you are in me, and I am in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Those who accept my commandments and obey them are the ones who love me. And because they love me, my Father will love them. And I will love them and reveal myself to each of them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judas (not Judas Iscariot, but the other disciple with that name) said to him, “Lord, why are you going to reveal yourself only to us and not to the world at large?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “All who love me will do what I say. My Father will love them, and we will come and make our home with each of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone who doesn’t love me will not obey me. And remember, my words are not my own. What I am telling you is from the Father who sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am telling you these things now while I am still with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when the Father sends the Advocate as my representative—that is, the Holy Spirit—he will teach you everything and will remind you of everything I have told you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I am leaving you with a gift—peace of mind and heart. And the peace I give is a gift the world cannot give. So don’t be troubled or afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember what I told you: I am going away, but I will come back to you again. If you really loved me, you would be happy that I am going to the Father, who is greater than I am.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have told you these things before they happen so that when they do happen, you will believe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I don’t have much more time to talk to you, because the ruler of this world approaches. He has no power over me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but I will do what the Father requires of me, so that the world will know that I love the Father. Come, let’s be going.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I am the true grapevine, and my Father is the gardener.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He cuts off every branch of mine that doesn’t produce fruit, and he prunes the branches that do bear fruit so they will produce even more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have already been pruned and purified by the message I have given you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remain in me, and I will remain in you. For a branch cannot produce fruit if it is severed from the vine, and you cannot be fruitful unless you remain in me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Yes, I am the vine; you are the branches. Those who remain in me, and I in them, will produce much fruit. For apart from me you can do nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone who does not remain in me is thrown away like a useless branch and withers. Such branches are gathered into a pile to be burned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if you remain in me and my words remain in you, you may ask for anything you want, and it will be granted!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you produce much fruit, you are my true disciples. This brings great glory to my Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have loved you even as the Father has loved me. Remain in my love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you obey my commandments, you remain in my love, just as I obey my Father’s commandments and remain in his love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have told you these things so that you will be filled with my joy. Yes, your joy will overflow!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is my commandment: Love each other in the same way I have loved you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There is no greater love than to lay down one’s life for one’s friends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are my friends if you do what I command.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I no longer call you slaves, because a master doesn’t confide in his slaves. Now you are my friends, since I have told you everything the Father told me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You didn’t choose me. I chose you. I appointed you to go and produce lasting fruit, so that the Father will give you whatever you ask for, using my name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is my command: Love each other.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “If the world hates you, remember that it hated me first.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The world would love you as one of its own if you belonged to it, but you are no longer part of the world. I chose you to come out of the world, so it hates you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do you remember what I told you? ‘A slave is not greater than the master.’ Since they persecuted me, naturally they will persecute you. And if they had listened to me, they would listen to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They will do all this to you because of me, for they have rejected the one who sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They would not be guilty if I had not come and spoken to them. But now they have no excuse for their sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Anyone who hates me also hates my Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I hadn’t done such miraculous signs among them that no one else could do, they would not be guilty. But as it is, they have seen everything I did, yet they still hate me and my Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This fulfills what is written in their Scriptures: ‘They hated me without cause.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But I will send you the Advocate—the Spirit of truth. He will come to you from the Father and will testify all about me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And you must also testify about me because you have been with me from the beginning of my ministry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have told you these things so that you won’t abandon your faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you will be expelled from the synagogues, and the time is coming when those who kill you will think they are doing a holy service for God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is because they have never known the Father or me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yes, I’m telling you these things now, so that when they happen, you will remember my warning. I didn’t tell you earlier because I was going to be with you for a while longer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “But now I am going away to the one who sent me, and not one of you is asking where I am going.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Instead, you grieve because of what I’ve told you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But in fact, it is best for you that I go away, because if I don’t, the Advocate won’t come. If I do go away, then I will send him to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when he comes, he will convict the world of its sin, and of God’s righteousness, and of the coming judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The world’s sin is that it refuses to believe in me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Righteousness is available because I go to the Father, and you will see me no more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judgment will come because the ruler of this world has already been judged.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “There is so much more I want to tell you, but you can’t bear it now.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the Spirit of truth comes, he will guide you into all truth. He will not speak on his own but will tell you what he has heard. He will tell you about the future.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He will bring me glory by telling you whatever he receives from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All that belongs to the Father is mine; this is why I said, ‘The Spirit will tell you whatever he receives from me.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “In a little while you won’t see me anymore. But a little while after that, you will see me again.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Some of the disciples asked each other, “What does he mean when he says, ‘In a little while you won’t see me, but then you will see me,’ and ‘I am going to the Father’?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And what does he mean by ‘a little while’? We don’t understand.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus realized they wanted to ask him about it, so he said, “Are you asking yourselves what I meant? I said in a little while you won’t see me, but a little while after that you will see me again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I tell you the truth, you will weep and mourn over what is going to happen to me, but the world will rejoice. You will grieve, but your grief will suddenly turn to wonderful joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It will be like a woman suffering the pains of labor. When her child is born, her anguish gives way to joy because she has brought a new baby into the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So you have sorrow now, but I will see you again; then you will rejoice, and no one can rob you of that joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At that time you won’t need to ask me for anything. I tell you the truth, you will ask the Father directly, and he will grant your request because you use my name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You haven’t done this before. Ask, using my name, and you will receive, and you will have abundant joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have spoken of these matters in figures of speech, but soon I will stop speaking figuratively and will tell you plainly all about the Father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then you will ask in my name. I’m not saying I will ask the Father on your behalf,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for the Father himself loves you dearly because you love me and believe that I came from God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yes, I came from the Father into the world, and now I will leave the world and return to the Father.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then his disciples said, “At last you are speaking plainly and not figuratively.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now we understand that you know everything, and there’s no need to question you. From this we believe that you came from God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus asked, “Do you finally believe?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But the time is coming—indeed it’s here now—when you will be scattered, each one going his own way, leaving me alone. Yet I am not alone because the Father is with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have told you all this so that you may have peace in me. Here on earth you will have many trials and sorrows. But take heart, because I have overcome the world.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After saying all these things, Jesus looked up to heaven and said, “Father, the hour has come. Glorify your Son so he can give glory back to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you have given him authority over everyone. He gives eternal life to each one you have given him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And this is the way to have eternal life—to know you, the only true God, and Jesus Christ, the one you sent to earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I brought glory to you here on earth by completing the work you gave me to do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now, Father, bring me into the glory we shared before the world began.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have revealed you to the ones you gave me from this world. They were always yours. You gave them to me, and they have kept your word.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now they know that everything I have is a gift from you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for I have passed on to them the message you gave me. They accepted it and know that I came from you, and they believe you sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “My prayer is not for the world, but for those you have given me, because they belong to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All who are mine belong to you, and you have given them to me, so they bring me glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now I am departing from the world; they are staying in this world, but I am coming to you. Holy Father, you have given me your name; now protect them by the power of your name so that they will be united just as we are.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: During my time here, I protected them by the power of the name you gave me. I guarded them so that not one was lost, except the one headed for destruction, as the Scriptures foretold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now I am coming to you. I told them many things while I was with them in this world so they would be filled with my joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have given them your word. And the world hates them because they do not belong to the world, just as I do not belong to the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I’m not asking you to take them out of the world, but to keep them safe from the evil one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They do not belong to this world any more than I do.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Make them holy by your truth; teach them your word, which is truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Just as you sent me into the world, I am sending them into the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And I give myself as a holy sacrifice for them so they can be made holy by your truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I am praying not only for these disciples but also for all who will ever believe in me through their message.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I pray that they will all be one, just as you and I are one—as you are in me, Father, and I am in you. And may they be in us so that the world will believe you sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I have given them the glory you gave me, so they may be one as we are one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am in them and you are in me. May they experience such perfect unity that the world will know that you sent me and that you love them as much as you love me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Father, I want these whom you have given me to be with me where I am. Then they can see all the glory you gave me because you loved me even before the world began!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “O righteous Father, the world doesn’t know you, but I do; and these disciples know you sent me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have revealed you to them, and I will continue to do so. Then your love for me will be in them, and I will be in them.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After saying these things, Jesus crossed the Kidron Valley with his disciples and entered a grove of olive trees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Judas, the betrayer, knew this place, because Jesus had often gone there with his disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The leading priests and Pharisees had given Judas a contingent of Roman soldiers and Temple guards to accompany him. Now with blazing torches, lanterns, and weapons, they arrived at the olive grove.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus fully realized all that was going to happen to him, so he stepped forward to meet them. “Who are you looking for?” he asked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Jesus the Nazarene,” they replied.
“I am he,” Jesus said. (Judas, who betrayed him, was standing with them.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As Jesus said “I am he,” they all drew back and fell to the ground!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Once more he asked them, “Who are you looking for?”
And again they replied, “Jesus the Nazarene.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I told you that I am he,” Jesus said. “And since I am the one you want, let these others go.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He did this to fulfill his own statement: “I did not lose a single one of those you have given me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Simon Peter drew a sword and slashed off the right ear of Malchus, the high priest’s slave.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But Jesus said to Peter, “Put your sword back into its sheath. Shall I not drink from the cup of suffering the Father has given me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the soldiers, their commanding officer, and the Temple guards arrested Jesus and tied him up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: First they took him to Annas, since he was the father-in-law of Caiaphas, the high priest at that time.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Caiaphas was the one who had told the other Jewish leaders, “It’s better that one man should die for the people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Simon Peter followed Jesus, as did another of the disciples. That other disciple was acquainted with the high priest, so he was allowed to enter the high priest’s courtyard with Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter had to stay outside the gate. Then the disciple who knew the high priest spoke to the woman watching at the gate, and she let Peter in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The woman asked Peter, “You’re not one of that man’s disciples, are you?”
“No,” he said, “I am not.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because it was cold, the household servants and the guards had made a charcoal fire. They stood around it, warming themselves, and Peter stood with them, warming himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Inside, the high priest began asking Jesus about his followers and what he had been teaching them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “Everyone knows what I teach. I have preached regularly in the synagogues and the Temple, where the people gather. I have not spoken in secret.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why are you asking me this question? Ask those who heard me. They know what I said.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then one of the Temple guards standing nearby slapped Jesus across the face. “Is that the way to answer the high priest?” he demanded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “If I said anything wrong, you must prove it. But if I’m speaking the truth, why are you beating me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Annas bound Jesus and sent him to Caiaphas, the high priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Meanwhile, as Simon Peter was standing by the fire warming himself, they asked him again, “You’re not one of his disciples, are you?”
He denied it, saying, “No, I am not.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But one of the household slaves of the high priest, a relative of the man whose ear Peter had cut off, asked, “Didn’t I see you out there in the olive grove with Jesus?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again Peter denied it. And immediately a rooster crowed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus’ trial before Caiaphas ended in the early hours of the morning. Then he was taken to the headquarters of the Roman governor. His accusers didn’t go inside because it would defile them, and they wouldn’t be allowed to celebrate the Passover.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Pilate, the governor, went out to them and asked, “What is your charge against this man?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “We wouldn’t have handed him over to you if he weren’t a criminal!” they retorted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Then take him away and judge him by your own law,” Pilate told them.
“Only the Romans are permitted to execute someone,” the Jewish leaders replied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (This fulfilled Jesus’ prediction about the way he would die.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pilate went back into his headquarters and called for Jesus to be brought to him. “Are you the king of the Jews?” he asked him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “Is this your own question, or did others tell you about me?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Am I a Jew?” Pilate retorted. “Your own people and their leading priests brought you to me for trial. Why? What have you done?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus answered, “My Kingdom is not an earthly kingdom. If it were, my followers would fight to keep me from being handed over to the Jewish leaders. But my Kingdom is not of this world.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pilate said, “So you are a king?”
Jesus responded, “You say I am a king. Actually, I was born and came into the world to testify to the truth. All who love the truth recognize that what I say is true.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “What is truth?” Pilate asked. Then he went out again to the people and told them, “He is not guilty of any crime.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But you have a custom of asking me to release one prisoner each year at Passover. Would you like me to release this ‘King of the Jews’?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But they shouted back, “No! Not this man. We want Barabbas!” (Barabbas was a revolutionary.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pilate had Jesus flogged with a lead-tipped whip.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The soldiers wove a crown of thorns and put it on his head, and they put a purple robe on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Hail! King of the Jews!” they mocked, as they slapped him across the face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate went outside again and said to the people, “I am going to bring him out to you now, but understand clearly that I find him not guilty.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus came out wearing the crown of thorns and the purple robe. And Pilate said, “Look, here is the man!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When they saw him, the leading priests and Temple guards began shouting, “Crucify him! Crucify him!”
“Take him yourselves and crucify him,” Pilate said. “I find him not guilty.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The Jewish leaders replied, “By our law he ought to die because he called himself the Son of God.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Pilate heard this, he was more frightened than ever.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He took Jesus back into the headquarters again and asked him, “Where are you from?” But Jesus gave no answer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Why don’t you talk to me?” Pilate demanded. “Don’t you realize that I have the power to release you or crucify you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus said, “You would have no power over me at all unless it were given to you from above. So the one who handed me over to you has the greater sin.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Pilate tried to release him, but the Jewish leaders shouted, “If you release this man, you are no ‘friend of Caesar.’ Anyone who declares himself a king is a rebel against Caesar.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they said this, Pilate brought Jesus out to them again. Then Pilate sat down on the judgment seat on the platform that is called the Stone Pavement (in Hebrew, Gabbatha).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was now about noon on the day of preparation for the Passover. And Pilate said to the people, “Look, here is your king!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Away with him,” they yelled. “Away with him! Crucify him!”
“What? Crucify your king?” Pilate asked.
“We have no king but Caesar,” the leading priests shouted back.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then Pilate turned Jesus over to them to be crucified.
So they took Jesus away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Carrying the cross by himself, he went to the place called Place of the Skull (in Hebrew, Golgotha).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: There they nailed him to the cross. Two others were crucified with him, one on either side, with Jesus between them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Pilate posted a sign on the cross that read, “Jesus of Nazareth, the King of the Jews.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The place where Jesus was crucified was near the city, and the sign was written in Hebrew, Latin, and Greek, so that many people could read it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the leading priests objected and said to Pilate, “Change it from ‘The King of the Jews’ to ‘He said, I am King of the Jews.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Pilate replied, “No, what I have written, I have written.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When the soldiers had crucified Jesus, they divided his clothes among the four of them. They also took his robe, but it was seamless, woven in one piece from top to bottom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they said, “Rather than tearing it apart, let’s throw dice for it.” This fulfilled the Scripture that says, “They divided my garments among themselves and threw dice for my clothing.” So that is what they did.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Standing near the cross were Jesus’ mother, and his mother’s sister, Mary (the wife of Clopas), and Mary Magdalene.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus saw his mother standing there beside the disciple he loved, he said to her, “Dear woman, here is your son.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he said to this disciple, “Here is your mother.” And from then on this disciple took her into his home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus knew that his mission was now finished, and to fulfill Scripture he said, “I am thirsty.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: A jar of sour wine was sitting there, so they soaked a sponge in it, put it on a hyssop branch, and held it up to his lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When Jesus had tasted it, he said, “It is finished!” Then he bowed his head and gave up his spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It was the day of preparation, and the Jewish leaders didn’t want the bodies hanging there the next day, which was the Sabbath (and a very special Sabbath, because it was Passover week). So they asked Pilate to hasten their deaths by ordering that their legs be broken. Then their bodies could be taken down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the soldiers came and broke the legs of the two men crucified with Jesus.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But when they came to Jesus, they saw that he was already dead, so they didn’t break his legs.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of the soldiers, however, pierced his side with a spear, and immediately blood and water flowed out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: (This report is from an eyewitness giving an accurate account. He speaks the truth so that you also may continue to believe.)
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: These things happened in fulfillment of the Scriptures that say, “Not one of his bones will be broken,”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and “They will look on the one they pierced.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Afterward Joseph of Arimathea, who had been a secret disciple of Jesus (because he feared the Jewish leaders), asked Pilate for permission to take down Jesus’ body. When Pilate gave permission, Joseph came and took the body away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With him came Nicodemus, the man who had come to Jesus at night. He brought about seventy-five pounds of perfumed ointment made from myrrh and aloes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Following Jewish burial custom, they wrapped Jesus’ body with the spices in long sheets of linen cloth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The place of crucifixion was near a garden, where there was a new tomb, never used before.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And so, because it was the day of preparation for the Jewish Passover and since the tomb was close at hand, they laid Jesus there.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Early on Sunday morning, while it was still dark, Mary Magdalene came to the tomb and found that the stone had been rolled away from the entrance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She ran and found Simon Peter and the other disciple, the one whom Jesus loved. She said, “They have taken the Lord’s body out of the tomb, and we don’t know where they have put him!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter and the other disciple started out for the tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They were both running, but the other disciple outran Peter and reached the tomb first.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He stooped and looked in and saw the linen wrappings lying there, but he didn’t go in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Simon Peter arrived and went inside. He also noticed the linen wrappings lying there,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: while the cloth that had covered Jesus’ head was folded up and lying apart from the other wrappings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the disciple who had reached the tomb first also went in, and he saw and believed—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for until then they still hadn’t understood the Scriptures that said Jesus must rise from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then they went home.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mary was standing outside the tomb crying, and as she wept, she stooped and looked in.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She saw two white-robed angels, one sitting at the head and the other at the foot of the place where the body of Jesus had been lying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Dear woman, why are you crying?” the angels asked her.
“Because they have taken away my Lord,” she replied, “and I don’t know where they have put him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: She turned to leave and saw someone standing there. It was Jesus, but she didn’t recognize him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Dear woman, why are you crying?” Jesus asked her. “Who are you looking for?”
She thought he was the gardener. “Sir,” she said, “if you have taken him away, tell me where you have put him, and I will go and get him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Mary!” Jesus said.
She turned to him and cried out, “Rabboni!” (which is Hebrew for “Teacher”).
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Don’t cling to me,” Jesus said, “for I haven’t yet ascended to the Father. But go find my brothers and tell them, ‘I am ascending to my Father and your Father, to my God and your God.’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Mary Magdalene found the disciples and told them, “I have seen the Lord!” Then she gave them his message.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That Sunday evening the disciples were meeting behind locked doors because they were afraid of the Jewish leaders. Suddenly, Jesus was standing there among them! “Peace be with you,” he said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As he spoke, he showed them the wounds in his hands and his side. They were filled with joy when they saw the Lord!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again he said, “Peace be with you. As the Father has sent me, so I am sending you.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he breathed on them and said, “Receive the Holy Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If you forgive anyone’s sins, they are forgiven. If you do not forgive them, they are not forgiven.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: One of the twelve disciples, Thomas (nicknamed the Twin), was not with the others when Jesus came.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They told him, “We have seen the Lord!”
But he replied, “I won’t believe it unless I see the nail wounds in his hands, put my fingers into them, and place my hand into the wound in his side.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Eight days later the disciples were together again, and this time Thomas was with them. The doors were locked; but suddenly, as before, Jesus was standing among them. “Peace be with you,” he said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said to Thomas, “Put your finger here, and look at my hands. Put your hand into the wound in my side. Don’t be faithless any longer. Believe!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “My Lord and my God!” Thomas exclaimed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus told him, “You believe because you have seen me. Blessed are those who believe without seeing me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The disciples saw Jesus do many other miraculous signs in addition to the ones recorded in this book.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But these are written so that you may continue to believe that Jesus is the Messiah, the Son of God, and that by believing in him you will have life by the power of his name.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Later, Jesus appeared again to the disciples beside the Sea of Galilee. This is how it happened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Several of the disciples were there—Simon Peter, Thomas (nicknamed the Twin), Nathanael from Cana in Galilee, the sons of Zebedee, and two other disciples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Simon Peter said, “I’m going fishing.”
“We’ll come, too,” they all said. So they went out in the boat, but they caught nothing all night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At dawn Jesus was standing on the beach, but the disciples couldn’t see who he was.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He called out, “Fellows, have you caught any fish?”
“No,” they replied.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then he said, “Throw out your net on the right-hand side of the boat, and you’ll get some!” So they did, and they couldn’t haul in the net because there were so many fish in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then the disciple Jesus loved said to Peter, “It’s the Lord!” When Simon Peter heard that it was the Lord, he put on his tunic (for he had stripped for work), jumped into the water, and headed to shore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The others stayed with the boat and pulled the loaded net to the shore, for they were only about a hundred yards from shore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When they got there, they found breakfast waiting for them—fish cooking over a charcoal fire, and some bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Bring some of the fish you’ve just caught,” Jesus said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Simon Peter went aboard and dragged the net to the shore. There were 153 large fish, and yet the net hadn’t torn.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “Now come and have some breakfast!” Jesus said. None of the disciples dared to ask him, “Who are you?” They knew it was the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jesus served them the bread and the fish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This was the third time Jesus had appeared to his disciples since he had been raised from the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
After breakfast Jesus asked Simon Peter, “Simon son of John, do you love me more than these?”
“Yes, Lord,” Peter replied, “you know I love you.”
“Then feed my lambs,” Jesus told him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jesus repeated the question: “Simon son of John, do you love me?”
“Yes, Lord,” Peter said, “you know I love you.”
“Then take care of my sheep,” Jesus said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A third time he asked him, “Simon son of John, do you love me?”
Peter was hurt that Jesus asked the question a third time. He said, “Lord, you know everything. You know that I love you.”
Jesus said, “Then feed my sheep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “I tell you the truth, when you were young, you were able to do as you liked; you dressed yourself and went wherever you wanted to go. But when you are old, you will stretch out your hands, and others will dress you and take you where you don’t want to go.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus said this to let him know by what kind of death he would glorify God. Then Jesus told him, “Follow me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter turned around and saw behind them the disciple Jesus loved—the one who had leaned over to Jesus during supper and asked, “Lord, who will betray you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Peter asked Jesus, “What about him, Lord?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus replied, “If I want him to remain alive until I return, what is that to you? As for you, follow me.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So the rumor spread among the community of believers that this disciple wouldn’t die. But that isn’t what Jesus said at all. He only said, “If I want him to remain alive until I return, what is that to you?”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This disciple is the one who testifies to these events and has recorded them here. And we know that his account of these things is accurate.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Jesus also did many other things. If they were all written down, I suppose the whole world could not contain the books that would be written.
verses.speaker: Narrator
